recipes.Name: Fried Eggs
Steps: Step 1: Preheat pan on high heat.
Step 2: Spread 1 tablespoon of oil.
Step 3: Crack egg into the pan.
Step 4: Spoon the oil over the egg until whites are set.
Step 5: Take it out of the pan. Apply salt and pepper then serve.

recipes.Name: Spicy Chicken Fried Rice
recipes.Description: A good fried rice recipe that is easy to cook and usually whips up pretty quickly. It's good to have leftover rice around just so you can make this particular dish.
Steps: Step 1: Cook the eggs. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large pan or wok to medium-high heat. Add eggs and cook, stirring, until the eggs set and are nice   and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Don't overcook the eggs. Transfer the eggs to a bowl and set aside.

Step 2: Return pan to heat. Add an additional 1 tablespoon oil to the pan and heat until melted. Add onion and garlic, and season with a generous pinch of salt and pepper. Saute for about 5 minutes or until the onions are soft.
Step 3: Increase heat to high, add in the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of oil, and stir until melted. Immediately add the rice and stir until combined.
Step 4: Add the sriracha and continue stirring for an additional 3 minutes to fry the rice. Then add in the chicken and eggs, and stir to combine.
Step 5: Remove from heat and serve.

recipes.Name: Chicken Katsu
recipes.Description: Chicken katsu is Japanese-style fried chicken. This is my family recipe and can also be used to make tonkatsu by using pork cutlets instead of chicken. Served with white rice.
Steps: Step 1: Season chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Place flour, beaten egg, and panko crumbs into separate shallow dishes.
Step 2: Coat chicken breasts in flour, shaking off any excess; dip into egg, and then press into panko crumbs until well coated on both sides.
Step 3: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place chicken in the hot oil, and fry until golden brown, 3 or 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
Step 3: Serve with white rice.

recipes.Name: Hashbrowns
recipes.Description: Hash browns are one of those brilliant recipes that taste amazing, look impressive and take very little effort. A welcome addition to any breakfast or lunch.
Steps: Step 1: Coarsely grate the potatoes and onion into a clean tea towel and then squeeze out the excess liquid by twisting the towel. Place the mix in a large bowl.
Step 2: Add a good couple of pinches of salt and freshly ground black pepper (you need to salt the mixture well otherwise the hash browns can be quite bland). Mix the ingredients well.

Step 3: Heat a good glug of oil in a heavy based frying pan and when the oil is hot (but not smoking), add spoonfuls of the potato mixture into the pan and flatten into patties about 1cm/½in thick. Flip over once browned and crispy - about 2-3 minutes each side.
Step 4: Serve hot as a breakfast or supper side dish. Especially good with bacon and eggs.

recipes.Name: Mashed Potatoes
recipes.Description: A simple to make dish that everyone is sure to enjoy. It's simple to make and pairs well with any main course or by itself
Steps: Step 1: Place potatoes in a large saucepan; cover with water. Cover and bring to a boil. Cook for 20-25 minutes or until very tender; drain well.

Step 2: In a bowl, mash potatoes. Add cheddar cheese, onion, egg, salt and pepper; beat until fluffy. Transfer to a 2-qt. baking dish that is greased with oil. Cover and bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with additional cheese if desired.
Step 3: Serve on the side or as a meal.
